title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The Justice Department is investigating whether Visa is engaging in anticompetitive practices in the debit-card market, a probe that casts a cloud over a core part of its business.

---

China is restricting the use of Tesla's vehicles by military staff and employees of key state-owned firms, citing concerns that data the cars gather could be a source of national-security leaks.

---

The Federal Reserve said it was ending a yearlong reprieve that had eased capital requirements for big banks, disappointing Wall Street firms that had lobbied for an extension.

---

The Dow and S&P 500 retreated 0.7% and 0.1%, respectively, while the Nasdaq gained 0.8%. All three indexes posted weekly losses of less than 1%.

---

Agricultural giant Corteva averted a potential proxy fight with Starboard by giving the activist hedge fund three seats on its board.

---

British Airways is considering selling its sprawling headquarters on the periphery of London Heathrow Airport.

---

Coinbase agreed to pay $6.5 million to settle regulatory claims that it reported misleading information about its trading volumes.
